verses.verse: {To the Director: A song by the Sons of Korah.} {The Destiny of the Wicked and the Upright} d Listen to this, all you people! Pay attention, all you who live in the world,
both average people and those of means, {Lit. both sons of Adam and sons of men} the rich and the poor together.
My mouth will speak wisely, and I will understand what I think about.
I will focus my attention on {Lit. will incline my ear to} a proverb; I will use the harp to expound my riddle.
Why should I be afraid when evil days come my way, when the wickedness of those who deceive me surrounds me
those who put confidence in their wealth and boast about their great riches?
No man can redeem the life of another, {Lit. of a brother} nor can he give to God a sufficient payment for him
for it would cost too much to redeem his life, and the payments would go on forever
that he should go on living and not see corruption.
Indeed, he will see wise people die; the stupid and the senseless will meet their doom and leave their wealth to others.
Their inner thoughts are on {So MT DSS 4QPs c 4QPs j ; LXX reads Their graves are} their homes forever; their dwellings from generation to generation. They even name their lands after themselves.

But humanity cannot last, despite its conceit; {So MT; DSS 4QPs c Syr LXX read Humans, held in honor, had no understanding;} it will pass away just like the animals. {So MT; LXX reads they resembled senseless animals, and became like them ; DSS 4QPs c read they are like animals that perish}
This is the fate of those who are foolish and of those who correct their words after they speak. (Interlude)

Like sheep, they are destined for the realm of the dead, {Lit. for Sheol ; i. e. the realm of the dead} with death as their shepherd. The upright will have dominion over them in the morning; their strength will be consumed in the afterlife, {Lit. in Sheol ; i. e. the realm of the dead} so that they have no home.
God will truly redeem me from the power {Lit. hand} of Sheol. {I. e. the realm of the dead} He will surely receive me! Interlude
Don't be afraid when someone gets rich, when the glory of his household increases.
When he dies, he will not be able to take it all with him {The Heb. lacks with him} his possessions {Or glory} will not follow him to the grave, {The Heb. lacks to the grave}
although he considers himself blessed while he's alive. Though people praise you for doing well,
you will end up like your {Lit. his} ancestors'generation, never again to see the light of day!
Humanity, despite its conceit, does not understand that it will perish, just like the animals.
